fields.name: Load Document Corpus From File
fields.description: This widges processes raw text file and loads the texts into ADC (Annotated Document Corpus) structure. The input file contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document. In case lines contain more document properties (i.e.: ids, titles, labels,...) than other widgets should be used to load ADC structure.

fields.name: Raw Text File
fields.description: Input Text File: Contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document.

fields.name: Text before the first tabulator [/t] represents the title of a document
First words in a line (after optional title) with preceding exclamation (!) present labels
Load Document Corpus From String
fields.description: This widges processes raw text file and loads the texts into ADC (Annotated Document Corpus) structure. The input file contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document. In case lines contain more document properties (i.e.: ids, titles, labels,...) than other widgets should be used to load ADC structure.

fields.name: String
fields.description: Input Text String: Contains one document per line - the whole line represents text from the body of a document.

fields.name: Text before the first tabulator [/t] represents the title of a document
First words in a line (after optional title) with preceding exclamation (!) present labels

fields.name: Feature Condition
fields.description:
Condition which tokens to include based on their features.
Format examples:
-Feature1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set ta any value)
-Feature1=Value1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set to the value Value1)
-Feature1 +Feature2 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set unless it has also Feature2 set)
-Feature1=Value1 +Feature2 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set to Value1 unless it has also Feature2 set to any value)...

fields.name: AlphaLoose: accept tokens that contain at least one alphabetic character

fields.name: Token Tagger
fields.default:
Output feature name specifies how the token will be tagged (assigend the feature to)
If multiple taggers are used then one line per tagger must be specified.
fields.description:
Token Annotation of the token to be tagged. If also the feature name is used than the feature value of selected token will be tagged.
Usage: 
1. TokenName
2. TokenName/FeatureName
If multiple taggers are used then one line per tagger must be specified.

fields.name: Feature Condition
fields.description:
Condition which tokens to include based on their features.
Format examples:
-Feature1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set ta any value)
-Feature1=Value1 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set to the value Value1)
-Feature1 +Feature2 (don't include tokens with Feature1 set unless it has also Feature2 set)

fields.name: Token Annotation [ / Feature Name ] (one line per each tagger)
fields.description:
Token Annotation of the token to be tagged. If also the feature name is used than the feature value of selected token will be tagged.
Usage: 
1. TokenName
2. TokenName/FatureName
3. GroupTokenName/TokenName/FatureName
If multiple taggers are used then one line per tagger must be specified.

fields.name: Python Snippet
fields.description: Runs python snippet. You can use variable which is provided on the input by the name "in1" .. "inN". Whatever you want to otput needs to be asigned to the variable "out1" before the code is terminated

fields.name: in
fields.description: input can be accesed as variable "in1" .. "inN" inside the code

fields.name: Python Snippet Code
fields.default:
# This is the Python Code Snippet where you can modify the data however is needed.
# Varaible "in1" .. "inN" contains whatever you connected to the input port
# Whatever is assigned to the variable "out1" will be transfered to the output port.

out1 = in1
fields.description: Input can be accesed as variable "in1" .. "inN" inside the code and output can be accesed/assigned as variable "out1" inside the code.

fields.name: out
fields.description: output can be accesed/assigned as variable "out1" inside the code
